Detailed Description

template<class T>
class Util::Allocator< T >

Allocator of typed objects with cache for fast allocation (thread unsafe)

A list registers freed objects until a given theshold. Allocation tries to found a block in the list before using standard allocation. Deallocation puts a block in the list until list size is equal to threshold. At that time normal deallocation is done. We can define a new allocator of cells: 

    Allocator<X> A_of_X;

Member Function Documentation

template<class T >
T * Util::Allocator< T >::allocate (  )  [inline]

Alloc an object of type T. The return value points to a memory region that stores an array of size count_items where count_items is defined at initialization.

Reimplemented from Util::ByteAllocator.

template<class T >
void Util::Allocator< T >::initialize ( size_t  count_items,
size_t  bloc_size,
int  cache_count 
) [inline]

Initialize with a given bloc size and threshold Construct a ByteAllocator which allows to cache at most threshold cells.

Parameters:
count_items the number of item of type T allocated per allocation.
bloc_size is the size of each data cast to type T*.
cache_count the number of allocated bloc cached by the allocator
